newsitem.title: UK: New York set to launch first Eurobond on Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: New York set to launch first Eurobond on Wednesday.

text.p: New York City will launch its first public Eurobond on Wednesday following roadshows in Dublin, London and Frankfurt last week, syndicate officials at lead manager Goldman Sachs said on Tuesday.
The offering is expected to be a $300 million floating-rate note and is likely to see demand from European and Asian banks, they said.
The FRN will have a 5.5-year maturity with a 3.5-year average life, as the issue will be amortising.
Market sources said the pricing was expected to be in the 30 to 35 basis point range over three-month LIBOR.
"There are relatively few comparable benchmarks," a syndicate official said.
New York City is rated Baa1 by Moody's Investors Service and BBB+ by Standard & Poor's Corp.
The paper will carry a 20 percent risk weighting.
The proceeds of the Eurobond will be used to finance job creation and subsidised housing in the city of New York, the syndicate official said.
In June, New York launched a $180.5 million four-tranche private placement via Citibank. It also launched a Samurai bond in 1992.
